com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.packa.name: com.vmware.cis.tagging.sessions

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.documentation: Invalidates a session. Session Id should be provided in the SecurityContext.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.name: logout

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.documentation: Keeps a session id alive. Session Id should be provided in the SecurityContext.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.name: keep_alive

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.documentation: Logs a user and returns a session id. Authentication information should be provided in the SecurityContext.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.name: login

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.servi.documentation: Session management interface for the publish API
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.servi.name: com.vmware.cis.tagging.sessions.session_manager

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.packa.documentation: Copyright 2015 VMware, Inc.  All rights reserved. -- VMware Confidential Copyright 2013-2014 VMware, Inc. All rights reserved. -- VMware Confidential Copyright 2013-2015 VMware, Inc.  All rights reserved. -- VMware Confidential Copyright 2013-2014 VMware, Inc.  All rights reserved. -- VMware Confidential The {@name com.vmware.cis.tagging} {@term component} provides {@term operations} and {@term structures} to attach metadata, by means of tags, to vSphere objects to make these objects more sortable and searchable. You can use it to create, manage, and enumerate tags and their categories (the group a tag belongs to). You can also query the attached tags and attached objects.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.packa.name: com.vmware.cis.tagging

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.struc.documentation: The {@name CategoryModel} {@term structure} defines a category that is used to group one or more tags.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.struc.name: com.vmware.cis.tagging.category_model

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.enume.documentation: An object can only be assigned one of the tags in this category. For example, if a category is "Operating System", then different tags of this category would be "Windows", "Linux", and so on. In this case a VM object can be assigned only one of these tags and hence the cardinality of the associated category here is single.

An object can be assigned several of the tags in this category. For example, if a category is "Server", then different tags of this category would be "AppServer", "DatabaseServer" and so on. In this case a VM object can be assigned more than one of the above tags and hence the cardinality of the associated category here is multiple.
The {@name Cardinality} {@term enumerated type} defines the number of tags in a category that can be assigned to an object.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.enume.name: com.vmware.cis.tagging.category_model.cardinality

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The unique identifier of the category.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: id

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The display name of the category.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: name

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The description of the category.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: description

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The associated cardinality ({@enum.values Cardinality}) of the category.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: cardinality

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The types of objects that the tags in this category can be attached to. If the {@term set} is empty, then tags can be attached to all types of objects. This field works only for objects that reside in Inventory Service (IS). For non IS objects, this check is not performed today and hence a tag can be attached to any non IS object.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: associable_types

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The {@term set} of users that can use this category. To add users to this, you need to have the edit privilege on the category. Similarly, to unsubscribe from this category, you need the edit privilege on the category. You should not modify other users subscription from this {@term set}.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: used_by

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.struc.documentation: The {@name TagModel} {@term structure} defines a tag that can be attached to vSphere objects.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.struc.name: com.vmware.cis.tagging.tag_model

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The unique identifier of the tag.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: id

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The identifier of the parent category in which this tag will be created.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: category_id

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The display name of the tag.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: name

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The description of the tag.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: description

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The {@term set} of users that can use this tag. To add users to this, you need to have the edit privilege on the tag. Similarly, to unsubscribe from this tag, you need the edit privilege on the tag. You should not modify other users subscription from this {@term set}.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: used_by

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.documentation: The {@term list} of the object identifiers to all tag identifiers that are attached to that object.

Fetches the {@term list} of {@link ObjectToTags} describing the input object identifiers and the tags attached to each object. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the read privilege on each input object. The {@link ObjectToTags#tagIds} will only contain those tags for which you have the read privilege.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.name: list_attached_tags_on_objects

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The identifiers of the input objects.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: object_ids

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.documentation: The {@term list} of tag identifiers that are eligible to be attached to the given object.

Fetches the {@term list} of attachable tags for the given object, omitting the tags that have already been attached. Criteria for attachability is calculated based on tagging cardinality ({@link CategoryModel#cardinality}) and associability ({@link CategoryModel#associableTypes}) constructs. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the read privilege on the input object. The {@term list} will only contain those tags for which you have read privileges.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.name: list_attachable_tags

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The identifier of the input object.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: object_id

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.error.documentation: if you do not have the privilege to read the object.

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.documentation: Detaches the tag from the given object. If the tag is already removed from the object, then this {@term operation} is a no-op and an error will not be thrown. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the attach tag privilege on the tag and the read privilege on the object.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.name: detach

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The identifier of the input tag.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: tag_id

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The identifier of the input object.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: object_id

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.error.documentation: if the tag for the given {@param.name tagId} does not exist in the system.
if you do not have the privilege to detach the tag or do not have the privilege to read the given object.

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.documentation: The {@term list} of attached object identifiers.

Fetches the {@term list} of attached objects for the given tag. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the read privilege on the input tag. Only those objects for which you have the read privilege will be returned.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.name: list_attached_objects

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The identifier of the input tag.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: tag_id

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.error.documentation: if the tag for the given {@param.name tagId} does not exist in the system.
if you do not have the privilege to read the tag.

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.documentation: Attaches the given tag to the input object. The tag needs to meet the cardinality ({@link CategoryModel#cardinality}) and associability ({@link CategoryModel#associableTypes}) criteria in order to be eligible for attachment. If the tag is already attached to the object, then this {@term operation} is a no-op and an error will not be thrown. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the attach tag privilege on the tag and the read privilege on the object.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.name: attach

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The identifier of the input tag.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: tag_id

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The identifier of the input object.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: object_id

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.error.documentation: if the tag for the given {@param.name tagId} does not exist in the system.
if the input tag is not eligible to be attached to this object or if the {@param.name objectId} is not valid.
if you do not have the privilege to attach the tag or do not have the privilege to read the object.

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.documentation: The {@term list} of the tag identifiers to all object identifiers that each tag is attached to.

Fetches the {@term list} of {@link TagToObjects} describing the input tag identifiers and the objects they are attached to. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the read privilege on each input tag. The {@link TagToObjects#objectIds} will only contain those objects for which you have the read privilege.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.name: list_attached_objects_on_tags

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The identifiers of the input tags.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: tag_ids

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.documentation: The outcome of the batch {@term operation} and the {@term list} of error messages ({@link BatchResult#errorMessages}) describing attachment failures.

Attaches the given tags to the input object. If a tag is already attached to the object, then the individual {@term operation} is a no-op and an error will not be added to {@link BatchResult#errorMessages}. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the read privilege on the object and the attach tag privilege on each tag.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.name: attach_multiple_tags_to_object

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The identifier of the input object.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: object_id

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The identifiers of the input tags.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: tag_ids

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.error.documentation: if you do not have the privilege to read the object.

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.documentation: The outcome of the batch {@term operation} and the {@term list} of error messages ({@link BatchResult#errorMessages}) describing attachment failures.

Attaches the given tag to the input objects. If a tag is already attached to the object, then the individual {@term operation} is a no-op and an error will not be added to {@link BatchResult#errorMessages}. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the attach tag privilege on the tag and the read privilege on each object.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.name: attach_tag_to_multiple_objects

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The identifier of the input tag.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: tag_id

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The identifiers of the input objects.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: object_ids

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.error.documentation: if the tag for the given {@param.name tagId} does not exist in the system.
if you do not have the attach tag privilege on the tag.

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.documentation: The outcome of the batch {@term operation} and the {@term list} of error messages ({@link BatchResult#errorMessages}) describing detachment failures.

Detaches the given tag from the input objects. If a tag is already removed from the object, then the individual {@term operation} is a no-op and an error will not be added to {@link BatchResult#errorMessages}. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the attach tag privilege on the tag and the read privilege on each object.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.name: detach_tag_from_multiple_objects

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The identifier of the input tag.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: tag_id

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The identifiers of the input objects.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: object_ids

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.error.documentation: if the tag for the given tag does not exist in the system.
if you do not have the attach tag privilege on the tag.

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.documentation: The {@term list} of all tag identifiers that correspond to the tags attached to the given object.

Fetches the {@term list} of tags attached to the given object. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the read privilege on the input object. The {@term list} will only contain those tags for which you have the read privileges.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.name: list_attached_tags

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The identifier of the input object.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: object_id

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.error.documentation: if you do not have the privilege to read the object.

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.documentation: The outcome of the batch {@term operation} and the {@term list} of error messages ({@link BatchResult#errorMessages}) describing detachment failures.

Detaches the given tags from the input object. If a tag is already removed from the object, then the individual {@term operation} is a no-op and an error will not be added to {@link BatchResult#errorMessages}. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the read privilege on the object and the attach tag privilege each tag.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.name: detach_multiple_tags_from_object

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The identifier of the input object.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: object_id

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: tag_ids

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.struc.documentation: The {@name BatchResult} {@term structure} describes the result of performing the same {@term operation} on several tags or objects in a single invocation.

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The identifiers of the related tags.

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.documentation: Adds the {@param.name usedByEntity} to the {@link CategoryModel#usedBy} subscribers {@term set} for the specified category. If the {@param.name usedByEntity} is already in the {@term set}, then this becomes an idempotent no-op. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the modify {@link CategoryModel#usedBy} privilege on the category.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.name: add_to_used_by

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The identifier of the input category.

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.error.documentation: if the category for the given {@param.name categoryId} does not exist in the system.
if you do not have the privilege to add an entity to the {@link CategoryModel#usedBy} field.

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.documentation: The {@term list} of resource identifiers for the categories in the system that are used by {@param.name usedByEntity}.

Enumerates all categories for which the {@param.name usedByEntity} is part of the {@link CategoryModel#usedBy} subscribers {@term set}. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the read privilege on the individual categories.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.name: list_used_categories

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The field on which the results will be filtered.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: used_by_entity

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.documentation: The {@link CategoryModel} that corresponds to {@param.name categoryId}.
Fetches the category information for the given category identifier. In order to view the category information, you need the read privilege on the category.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.name: get

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The identifier of the input category.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: category_id

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.error.documentation: if the category for the given {@param.name categoryId} does not exist in the system.
if you do not have the privilege to read the category.

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.documentation: Revokes all propagating permissions on the given category. You should then attach a direct permission with tagging privileges on the given category. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need category related privileges (direct or propagating) on the concerned category.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.name: revoke_propagating_permissions

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The identifier of the input category.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: category_id

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.error.documentation: if the category for the given {@param.name categoryId} does not exist in the system.
if you do not have the privilege to revoke propagating permissions on the category.

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.documentation: The identifier of the created category.
Creates a category. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the create category privilege.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.name: create

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: Specification for the new category to be created.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: create_spec

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.error.documentation: if the {@link CreateSpec#name} provided in the {@param.name createSpec} is the name of an already existing category.
if any of the information in the {@param.name createSpec} is invalid.
if you do not have the privilege to create a category.

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.documentation: Updates an existing category. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the edit privilege on the category.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.name: update

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The identifier of the category to be updated.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: category_id

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: Specification to update the category.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: update_spec

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.error.documentation: if the {@link UpdateSpec#name} provided in the {@param.name updateSpec} is the name of an already existing category.
if any of the information in the {@param.name updateSpec} is invalid.
if the category for the given {@param.name categoryId} does not exist in the system.
if you do not have the privilege to update the category.

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.documentation: The {@term list} of resource identifiers for the categories in the system.

Enumerates the categories in the system. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the read privilege on the individual categories. The {@term list} will only contain those categories for which you have read privileges.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.name: list

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.documentation: Deletes an existing category. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the delete privilege on the category.

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: category_id

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.error.documentation: if the category for the given {@param.name categoryId} does not exist in the system.
if you do not have the privilege to delete the category.

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.documentation: Removes the {@param.name usedByEntity} from the {@link CategoryModel#usedBy} subscribers {@term set}. If the {@param.name usedByEntity} is not using this category, then this becomes a no-op. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the modify {@link CategoryModel#usedBy} privilege on the category.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.name: remove_from_used_by

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The identifier of the input category.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: category_id

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The name of the user to be removed from the {@link CategoryModel#usedBy} {@term set}.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: used_by_entity

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.error.documentation: if the category for the given {@param.name categoryId} does not exist in the system.
if you do not have the privilege to remove an entity from the {@link CategoryModel#usedBy} field.

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.servi.documentation: The {@name Category} {@term service} provides {@term operations} to create, read, update, delete, and enumerate categories.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.servi.name: com.vmware.cis.tagging.category

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.struc.documentation:
The {@name UpdateSpec} {@term structure} describes the updates to be made to an existing category.

Use the {@link #update} {@term operation} to modify a category. When you call the {@term operation}, specify the category identifier. You obtain the category identifier when you call the {@link #create} {@term operation}. You can also retrieve an identifier by using the {@link #list} {@term operation}.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.struc.name: com.vmware.cis.tagging.category.update_spec

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The display name of the category.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: name

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The description of the category.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: description

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The associated cardinality ({@enum.values Cardinality}) of the category.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: cardinality

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation:
Object types to which this category's tags can be attached.

The {@term set} of associable types cannot be updated incrementally. For example, if {@link #associableTypes} originally contains {A,B,C} and you want to add D, then you need to pass {A,B,C,D} in your update specification. You also cannot remove any item from this {@term set}. For example, if you have {A,B,C}, then you cannot remove say {A} from it. Similarly, if you start with an empty {@term set}, then that implies that you can tag any object and hence you cannot later pass say {A}, because that would be restricting the type of objects you want to tag. Thus, associable types can only grow and not shrink.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: associable_types

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.struc.documentation:
The {@name CreateSpec} {@term structure} is used to create a category.

Use the {@link #create} {@term operation} to create a category defined by the create specification.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.struc.name: com.vmware.cis.tagging.category.create_spec

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The display name of the category.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: name

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The description of the category.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: description

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The associated cardinality ({@enum.values Cardinality}) of the category.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: cardinality

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: Object types to which this category's tags can be attached.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: associable_types

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.documentation: Adds the {@param.name usedByEntity} to the {@link TagModel#usedBy} subscribers {@term set}. If the {@param.name usedByEntity} is already in the {@term set}, then this becomes a no-op. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the modify {@link TagModel#usedBy} privilege on the tag.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.name: add_to_used_by

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The identifier of the input tag.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: tag_id

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The name of the user to be added to the {@link TagModel#usedBy} {@term set}.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: used_by_entity

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.error.documentation: if the tag for the given {@param.name tagId} does not exist in the system.
if you do not have the privilege to add an entity to the {@link TagModel#usedBy} field.

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.documentation: The {@link TagModel} that corresponds to {@param.name tagId}.
Fetches the tag information for the given tag identifier. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the read privilege on the tag in order to view the tag info.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.name: get

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The identifier of the input tag.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: tag_id

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.error.documentation: if the tag for the given {@param.name tagId} does not exist in the system.
if the user does not have the privilege to read the tag.

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.documentation: Revokes all propagating permissions on the given tag. You should then attach a direct permission with tagging privileges on the given tag. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need tag related privileges (direct or propagating) on the concerned tag.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.name: revoke_propagating_permissions

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The identifier of the input tag.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: tag_id

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.error.documentation: if the tag for the given {@param.name tagId} does not exist in the system.
if you do not have the privilege to revoke propagating permissions on the tag.

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.documentation: The identifier of the created tag.
Creates a tag. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the create tag privilege on the input category.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.name: create

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: Specification for the new tag to be created.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: create_spec

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.error.documentation: if the {@link CreateSpec#name} provided in the {@param.name createSpec} is the name of an already existing tag in the input category.
if any of the input information in the {@param.name createSpec} is invalid.
if the category for in the given {@param.name createSpec} does not exist in the system.
if you do not have the privilege to create tag.

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.documentation: Updates an existing tag. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the edit privilege on the tag.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.name: update

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The identifier of the input tag.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: tag_id

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: Specification to update the tag.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: update_spec

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.error.documentation: if the {@link UpdateSpec#name} provided in the {@param.name updateSpec} is the name of an already existing tag in the same category.
if any of the input information in the {@param.name updateSpec} is invalid.
if the tag for the given {@param.name tagId} does not exist in the system.
if you do not have the privilege to update the tag.

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.documentation: The {@term list} of resource identifiers for the tags in the system.
Enumerates the tags in the system. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need read privilege on the individual tags. The {@term list} will only contain tags for which you have read privileges.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.name: list

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.documentation: The {@term list} of resource identifiers for the tags in the system that are used by {@param.name usedByEntity}.

Enumerates all tags for which the {@param.name usedByEntity} is part of the {@link TagModel#usedBy} subscribers {@term set}. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the read privilege on the individual tags.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.name: list_used_tags

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The field on which the results will be filtered.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: used_by_entity

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.documentation: Deletes an existing tag. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the delete privilege on the tag.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.name: delete

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The identifier of the input tag.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: tag_id

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.error.documentation: if the tag for the given {@param.name tagId} does not exist in the system.
if you do not have the privilege to delete the tag.

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.documentation: Removes the {@param.name usedByEntity} from the {@link TagModel#usedBy} subscribers set. If the {@param.name usedByEntity} is not using this tag, then this becomes a no-op. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need modify {@link TagModel#usedBy} privilege on the tag.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.name: remove_from_used_by

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The identifier of the input tag.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: tag_id

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The name of the user to be removed from the {@link TagModel#usedBy} {@term set}.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: used_by_entity

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.error.documentation: if the tag for the given {@param.name tagId} does not exist in the system.
if you do not have the privilege to remove an entity from the {@link TagModel#usedBy} field.

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.documentation: The {@term list} of resource identifiers for the tags in the given input category.
Enumerates all tags for the given category. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the read privilege on the given category and the individual tags in that category.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.name: list_tags_for_category

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The identifier of the input category.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: category_id

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.error.documentation: if the category for the given {@param.name categoryId} does not exist in the system.
if you do not have the privilege to read the category.

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.servi.documentation: The {@name Tag} {@term service} provides {@term operations} to create, read, update, delete, and enumerate tags.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.servi.name: com.vmware.cis.tagging.tag

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.struc.documentation:
The {@name UpdateSpec} {@term structure} describes the updates to be made to an existing tag.

Use the {@link #update} {@term operation} to modify a tag. When you call the {@term operation}, you specify the tag identifier. You obtain the tag identifier when you call the {@link #create} {@term operation}. You can also retrieve an identifier by using the {@link #list} {@term operation}.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.struc.name: com.vmware.cis.tagging.tag.update_spec

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The display name of the tag.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: name

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The description of the tag.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: description

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.struc.documentation:
The {@name CreateSpec} {@term structure} describes a tag.

Use the {@link #create} {@term operation} to create a tag defined by the create specification.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.struc.name: com.vmware.cis.tagging.tag.create_spec

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The display name of the tag. The name must be unique within its category.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: name

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The description of the tag.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: description

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The unique identifier of the parent category in which this tag will be created.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: category_id

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.documentation: The {@term list} of all {@link CategoryModel}s in the system.
Fetches all the category information in the system. You need the read privilege on each category to view its information.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.name: get_all_categories

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.documentation: The {@term list} of tag identifiers.
Enumerates all tags for the given @{term list} of categories. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the read privilege on each category and the individual tags in that category.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.name: list_tags_for_categories

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The identifiers of the input categories.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: category_ids

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.documentation: The {@term list} of {@link TagModel}s that corresponds to {@param.name tagIds}.
Fetches the tag information for the given tag identifiers. You need the read privilege on each tag to view its information.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.name: get_tags

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The identifiers of the input tags.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: tag_ids

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.documentation: The {@term list} of the object identifiers to all tag identifiers that are attached to that object.

Fetches the {@term list} of object identifier to the identifiers of the tags attached to that object. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the read privilege on each input object. The {@term list} of tag identifiers will only contain those tags for which you have read privileges.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.name: list_attached_tags_on_objects

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The identifiers of the input objects.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: object_ids

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.documentation: The {@term list} of {@link CategoryModel}s that corresponds to {@param.name categoryIds}.
Fetches the category information for the given category identifiers. You need the read privilege on each category to view its information.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.name: get_categories

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The identifiers of the input categories.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: category_ids

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.documentation: The {@term list} of object identifiers.

Fetches the {@term list} of object identifiers to which the input tags are attached. Objects will only appear once in the {@term list} regardless of if several input tags are attached to it. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the read privilege on each input tag. The {@term list} of object identifiers will only contain those objects for which you have read privileges. Note that this {@term operation} does not preserve the mappings between tag identifier and object identifiers.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.name: list_attached_objects

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The identifiers of the input tags.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: tag_ids

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.documentation: The {@term list} of tag identifiers for which the tags' names contain {@param.name tagName}

Enumerates all tags containing {@param.name tagName} in its names. You should note that tag names are only unique under its own category. To invoke this {@term opertaion}, you need the read privilege on each tag.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.name: find_tags_by_name

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The name of the tag.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: tag_name

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.documentation: The {@term list} of the tag identifiers to all object identifiers that each is attached to.

Fetches the {@term list} of tag identifier to the identifiers of the objects its attached to. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the read privilege on each input tag. The {@term list} of object identifiers will only contain those objects for which you have read privileges.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.name: list_attached_objects_on_tags

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The identifiers of the input tags.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: tag_ids

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.documentation: The {@term list} of the tag identifiers to all object identifiers that each is attached to.

Fetches the {@term list} of tag identifier to the identifiers of the objects its attached to for all tags in the system. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the read privilege on each tag to be returned. The {@term list} of object identifiers will only contain those objects for which you have read privileges.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.name: list_all_attached_objects_on_tags

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.documentation: The {@term list} of the object identifiers to all tag identifiers that are attached to that object.

Fetches the {@term list} of tag identifiers of the tags attached to the input objects. Tags will only appear once in the {@term list} regardless of if they are attached to several of the input objects. To invoke this {@term operation}, you need the read privilege on each input object. The {@term list} of tag identifiers will only contain those tags for which you have read privileges. Note that this {@term operation} does not preserve the mappings between object identifier and tag identifiers.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.name: list_attached_tags

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The identifiers of the input objects.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: object_ids

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.documentation: The {@term list} of all {@link TagModel}s in the system.
Fetches all tag information in the system. You need the read privilege on each tag to view its information.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.opera.name: get_all_tags

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.servi.documentation: The {@name Batch} {@term service} provides {@term operations} to query category, tag, and tag association information in batch. All {@term operations} return successfully. Error or insufficient privilege on an individual object will not result in a thrown exception, instead it will just be skipped.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.servi.name: com.vmware.cis.tagging.batch

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.struc.documentation: The {@name TagToObjects} {@term structure} describes a tag and its related objects. Use the {@link #listAttachedObjectsOnTags} {@term operation} or the {@link #listAllAttachedObjectsOnTags} {@term operation} to retrieve a {@term list} with each element containing a tag and objects its attached to.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.struc.name: com.vmware.cis.tagging.batch.tag_to_objects

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The identifier of the tag.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: tag_id

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The identifiers of the related objects.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: object_ids

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.struc.documentation: The {@name ObjectToTags} {@term structure} describes an object and its related tags. Use the {@link #listAttachedTagsOnObjects} {@term operation} to retrieve a {@term list} with each element containing an object and tags attached to it.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.struc.name: com.vmware.cis.tagging.batch.object_to_tags

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The identifier of the object.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: object_id

com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.documentation: The identifiers of the related tags.
com.vmware.vapi.metadata.metamodel.field.name: tag_ids
